title: What Does “Glooks” Mean in Text and on Social Media?

steps.title: “Glooks” is a slang term for “good looking out.”
steps.content: “Glooks” is a slang term for “good looking out.” It’s a combination of the words “good” and “looks,” and it’s used to express gratitude or show you appreciate something someone has done. The word “glooks” is an example of blending , a linguistics term for when 2 or more words are combined to form a new word —as in “brunch” (“breakfast” + “lunch”) or “smog” (“smoke” + “fog”). [1] X Research source

steps.title: “Glooks” probably started in New York City.
steps.content: “Glooks” probably started in New York City. You’ve probably heard the phrase “good looking out,” but in the Big Apple, where everyone moves a mile a minute, you say “good looks.” [2] X Research source “Glooks” is then an even more efficient form of the phrase—but whether “glooks” itself originated in NYC is unclear.

steps.title: Use it to express thanks.
steps.content: Use it to express thanks. When someone does you a favor, show you appreciate it with a quick and casual “glooks.” You can use it over text: “hey man what’d i miss in class today?” “i gotchu, i’ll send over my notes” “glooks bro!” On social media: “hey cutie! love the new selfie! 😘” “aww glooks babe! 💋” Or aloud in everyday conversation: “Hey, watch out for that car!” “Glooks, man! I wasn’t watching where I was going.”

steps.title: "Glook" may refer to the vintage Glook Gonk doll.
steps.content: "Glook" may refer to the vintage Glook Gonk doll. In the 1960s, the Gonk doll was introduced in the UK by inventor Robert Benson. Gonk dolls consist of a small, spherical body, long fur, and googly eyes, and they come in many varieties, one of which is called the "Glook Gonk."
